alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 6:32PM EDT until July 23 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Franklin IN and Ripley. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Batesville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Sunman, Metamora, Laurel, Peppertown, Hamburg, Huntersville, Buena Vista, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Andersonville and Penntown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
